# The `AbstractDependenceGraphBuilder` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This abstract builder class defines a set of high-level steps for creating DDG-like graphs. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>template &lt;class GraphType&gt;
class llvm::AbstractDependenceGraphBuilder&lt;GraphType&gt;</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This abstract builder class defines a set of high-level steps for creating DDG-like graphs.

The client code is expected to inherit from this class and define concrete implementation for each of the pure virtual functions used in the high-level algorithm.

Definition at line 31 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-h">DependenceGraphBuilder.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### computeInstructionOrdinals() {#a022f8d18fe9e9e880c51db47e2f372db}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class GraphType&gt;</>}
  prototype="void AbstractDependenceGraphBuilder::computeInstructionOrdinals ()">
Compute ordinal numbers for each instruction and store them in a map for future look up.

These ordinals are used to compute node ordinals which are in turn used to order nodes that are part of a cycle. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> ordinals are assigned based on lexical program order.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-h/#l00074">74</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-h">DependenceGraphBuilder.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-cpp/#l00042">42</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-cpp">DependenceGraphBuilder.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### createPiBlocks() {#afba90b653098f15528a273ced632683a}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class GraphType&gt;</>}
  prototype="void AbstractDependenceGraphBuilder::createPiBlocks ()">
Apply graph abstraction to groups of nodes that belong to a strongly connected component of the graph to create larger compound nodes called pi-blocks.

The purpose of this abstraction is to isolate sets of program elements that need to stay together during codegen and turn the dependence graph into an acyclic graph.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-h/#l00097">97</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-h">DependenceGraphBuilder.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-cpp/#l00091">91</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-cpp">DependenceGraphBuilder.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### populate() {#aa6cc092387721c9933bb8ec763767c3d}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class GraphType&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::AbstractDependenceGraphBuilder&lt; GraphType &gt;::populate ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
The main entry to the graph construction algorithm.

It starts by creating nodes in increasing order of granularity and then adds def-use and memory edges. As one of the final stages, it also creates pi-block nodes to facilitate codegen in transformations that use dependence graphs.

The algorithmic complexity of this implementation is O(V^2 &#42; I^2), where V is the number of vertecies (nodes) and I is the number of instructions in each node. The total number of instructions, N, is equal to V &#42; I, therefore the worst-case time complexity is O(N^2). The average time complexity is O((N^2)/2).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-h/#l00059">59</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-h">DependenceGraphBuilder.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### simplify() {#aa58986a6df89ded5c86fc981ad2bf53c}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class GraphType&gt;</>}
  prototype="void AbstractDependenceGraphBuilder::simplify ()">
Go through all the nodes in the graph and collapse any two nodes &#39;a&#39; and &#39;b&#39; if all of the following are true:

<ul>
<li>the only edge from &#39;a&#39; is a def-use edge to &#39;b&#39; and</li>
<li>the only edge to &#39;b&#39; is a def-use edge from &#39;a&#39; and</li>
<li>there is no cyclic edge from &#39;b&#39; to &#39;a&#39; and</li>
<li>all instructions in &#39;a&#39; and &#39;b&#39; belong to the same basic block and</li>
<li>both &#39;a&#39; and &#39;b&#39; are simple (single or multi instruction) nodes.</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-h/#l00106">106</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-h">DependenceGraphBuilder.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-cpp/#l00378">378</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/dependencegraphbuilder-cpp">DependenceGraphBuilder.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
